abstract.para: The topic covers creating of Podman pods by using &cockpit;.

topic.para: &cockpit; enables you to create pods in which you can then create containers. To create a pod, follow the steps:

step.para: Navigate to the Podman containers page.

listitem.para: Enter a unique name for the pod.
Specify whether the pod will be visible only under &rootuser; privileges or also to regular users.

After clicking Add port mapping, you can map a pod port onto a host port. Specify the container's port, assign the desired host port and IP address. If the host IP address is not set or is set to 0.0.0.0, the port is bonded to all host IP addresses. If you omit the host port number, a random port number is assigned to the mapping.
After clicking Add volume, you can map a directory on the host onto the container's volume. Select the host path, enter the path in containers and select the &selnx; labeling.

step.para: Click Create to confirm the pod creation.
